name: The Jewel Dunn's River Beach Resort & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Well I wanted to write this review as soon as I returned home but as luck has it work had me buried until now. We stayed at Jewel Dunn's River April 15-21st. This was our 3rd visit to this property 1st as Jewel. I have to say that I was a little nervous because I have always stayed with another major resort chain so this trip started a little out of my comfort zone. We landed in MBJ a little after noon on the 15th and had to wait for a few other couples, so we grabbed a beer, found our driver " Dale" who I must say was great, and waited for the others to arrive. Once everyone had got in we only had one issue and that was AA had lost a piece of luggage of one of the couples traveling with us. After dealing with that we decided to get on the road one piece of luggage light. The trip to JDR was great. We had are own bus which was nice, made a quick stop at the Jerk stand for a few more beers and some chicken and we were back on the road. When we arrived at the Jewel my concerns were immediately put to rest. We were welcomed like part of the family coming home for Christmas, I could not have been happier. Check in was very quick and we were off to our room. We received a nice upgrade with a great view of the beach,a nicely stocked bar and the room was clean as a whistle. That evening we went to the Managers cocktail party and met Scott the hotel Manager and had a chance to say hello to my friend Sharleen. By the end of the cocktail party we were shot after a long travel day so we called it a night. The rest of the week consisted of hanging out on the beach and taking part in a few of the activities around the pool. We met a ton of great people and many have become very good friends. We took part in the beach party that was set up perfectly and the food was second to none. I must reiterate that after 15 trips to Jamaica I do not think we have had better food than at the Jewel. One other note about the food was the room service. I could not believe how fast we were served in the room. I sometimes wondered if the were making the food in the hall it was to our room so quickly. In the evenings we watched the shows that the resort put on or hung out at the piano bar. Our last day we decided to rent a cabana and relax for the day. I was completely impressed on what a great decision that was, we were served breakfast right in front of our cabana which started the day off great. After breakfast Sheldon our cabana guy brought us a cooler full of beverages with everything you could of wanted and more. We soaked up sun all day and then at the end of the day went and cleaned up and got ready for our private beach dinner that was included with the cabana. I have to say the dinner was way more than I thought it was going to be and Sheldon went out of his way to make sure it was perfect. I would give you more details but I don't want to ruin the experience should you ever do this. Just trust me when I say it was worth every cent we paid. There are so many positive things that I could say about the Jewel that I could type all day. I will close with this. I would have to say this was at the top of my list for trips to Jamaica. The food and service is second to none and if I had to summarize in one word I would say " rejuvenating " . The entire Jewel staff went above and beyond so when I returned home I feltl like a new person. Heck it should almost be a campaign for them " Leave all you issues at home and let the Jewel staff rejuvenate you":) If you ever stay at the Jewel I am sure you will be very happy and if there is something that comes up that you are not happy with just grab Scott or one of his staff and I am sure they will do everything in their power to make it right. I am so happy we decided to leave our comfort zone and try another resort brand. Thank you Jewel and all the staff for making my 18th anniversary a great one! We will see you again very soon.
reviews.title: Rejuvenating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first vacation at an all inclusive resort, and because of our experience, we would certainly do this again, but will try to be more informed next time. Overall, I would love to give this resort 5 stars, but we had just a few setbacks. First of all, we chose the Jewel Dunn because of the adults only and the shuttle service to and from the airport. After a very long and tiring day of traveling, we had to wait for a shuttle to the resort for over 45 minutes. (very disorganized) The shuttle bus was small and somewhat rundown; not a good first impression of the resort. However, the driver was super friendly and knowledgeable, which really helped, as we had to travel about 1 1/2 hours to get to our resort. But once we got there, it was fantastic. The staff was very welcoming and kind. We found our room clean and comfortable, and the atmosphere so relaxing; we started our vacation. The resort is small, but has a luxurious feel to it. This is what we wanted and needed. All of the restaurants and food was wonderful (we really enjoyed Moonstone the most- the salad bar was exceptional) the entertainment staff was upbeat and fun, (excellent dancers!) and the service was excellent. The staff went out of their way to make us feel very welcome, from joining us for breakfast to fist bumps, smiles, and hugs. A special thank you to all who made our vacation very special-including the face of the resort (Jason) ;-)
reviews.title: The Jewel Dunn's River Resort is pretty amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our fantastic vacation ended on a sour note as when we went to check on our shuttle the morining of leaving, we were told by an extremely rude JTL staff that our shuttle had already left. We were shocked, as we had been told earlier that week that our shuttle would leave around 9:30. She curtly announced they rang our room around 8:05; we were at breakfast of course and did not hear it.. Had we known that we were to leave at 8:30, we would have been there. I asked if we could take the 9:20 shuttle and she snapped that it might be full and would be too late. She did not offer any other alternative, so we had to take a taxi, which cost us $110. We left around 9:10 and made it to the airport 2 hours before take offl We did not need to take a taxi. Having the shuttle was one of the reasons we booked this resort. Tip- know that you have to go through this Co. for your return to the airport and not the resort . . . I guess.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort with amazing staff and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The only other weird incident was that I had wrapped my husband's wet workout shorts in a towel to dry and found them missing after the housekeeper cleaned our room. I told the maid working across the hall, and she assured me she would check into it, but I never got a response from housekeeping, or the front desk. Strange.
reviews.title: We had a great time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would I still recommend this resort? Yes. What I liked most about the resort was the atmosphere, the friendly staff, and food. What I liked least was the shuttle service Co. and their staff.
reviews.title: great personal service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall very nice - room service, while 24 hours, costs extra if not within the diamond classification - same is true for stocked bar and fridge - this, unfortunately, does not equal other resorts within Jamaica - self-service while on the beach and at the pools, too - our mistake was traveling during Spring break so as the younger crowd arrived, the theme of the resort began to cater to younger crowd rather than stay relaxing and comfortable
reviews.title: Pleasing trip and, while very good, needs to improve to meet the quality of other resorts experienced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Jewel- just can't put in words of how great this vacation was. From the minute we stepped off the bus we were treated to the wonderful Jewel service from a fabulous staff that always went the extra-step in making us feel at home.
reviews.title: WOW!! Over the top !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was too easy- do as much or little as you want. Food was great with lots of dining options- During our stay we enjoyed diinner on the beach, pool deck dinner, Platinum fine dining and the Jade Samuri. With so many dining options we did not get to them all even during our stay. The entire staff including the entertainment Gems, bar, service, grounds crew, servers were over the top in hospitality.
reviews.title: Great Resort - Would definitely go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommend the Diamond Concierage rooms- direct waterfront with views of the pool area and mountains on the side. We enjoyed room service breakfast daily- so nice to start each day with a great breakfast in our room with a unobstrocted view of the Carribean Sea. Red Stripe lager was always cold in the mini-fridge along with soda, wine , champagne and stocked bar. So many bars- never a long wait for a refreshing frozen drink during the day or cocktail at night.
reviews.title: Great Stay at the Jewel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011
reviews.text: Pictures don't give justice to the absolutely wonderful grounds. Everyone made us feel welcome- this was so relaxing and lots of fun. Can't wait to get back.
reviews.title: Perfect Honeymoon Getaway.
It's not just, "All About The Water"
reviews.text: Just setting the stage: we are experienced travelers who use all-inclusives frequently - and have done so in Jamaica 5 or 6 times, the most recent before this trip being in November of 2012.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'll cut to the chase quick here and then move on to the perhaps more important stuff, but what annoyed "me" most about this resort can be summed up in one word: WATER.  OK, more correctly - two words: bottled water!  There was hardly any.  You could not get a bottle of water at any bar and when you asked for one, you were told to ask at the front desk.  Front desk: Nope!  Now in fairness there were a couple of bottles in the room and they had two water cooler-type things with melting ice in them. And the bars could dispense tap water.  But c'mon, Jewel!  It's the tropics!  Every other resort I've ever been to has had bottled water everywhere.  (And please don't "environment" me.  You're an enclosed resort.  You can recycle!)  If you want to play with the big boys, buy a couple of pallets of bottled water a week.  For what you're charging you can afford it!
reviews.title: 2013 Anniversary Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oh, and ice!  There are no ice machines anywhere, so you have to call the front desk or your concierge for ice.  Sometimes it was there in 10 minutes - sometimes 30; once it took an hour.  Wat's wit da wata, mon!?
reviews.title: great trip at this vintage beauty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pant, pant, pant... OK, I got that out of my system!
reviews.title: The Jewels here are the amazing staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012
reviews.text: I read a lot of then reviews on this property before we went and the most interesting thing about them is that they're all "almost" right.  The place has some really decent highs but also a lot of "needs improvements". I'll try to be fair about both categories.
reviews.title: impeccable service!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Jewel staff exceeded my expectations. The cold towel and cocktail welcome drink of the day were an excellent way to start our vacation. The property is beautiful and well kept. Our room was very clean. Staff was extremely pleasant and helpful.
reviews.title: GREAT STAY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bottled water was delivered constantly.
reviews.title: Great Experience!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: This was my first time to Jamaica and I loved it!!! 4/14-4/20
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Jewel-- The Staff was very friendly, the grounds were beautiful, the maid service seemed to come twice a day, and the mini fridge was always stocked. The food was pretty good for an all inclusive. We didn't really care for the Italian restaurant (moonstone), but the Jade was okay after they finally found my reservation (which I made before we arrived mind you ). I almost thought they weren't gonna let us in and was extremely disappointed as it was my fiance's birthday and they had no other openings during our stay. The waitress ended up seating us...I originally requested bubba but ended up being served by Simba?? I don't remember his name but it was still a pleasant experience, he was funny, we had a great crowd with great food! Our favorite restaurant was actually The Platinum which we loved because apparently they aren't as busy as the others. The pizza place was great. Loved, loved, love Gregory, Sara and all the others at the Grill. They really made our trip!!! It was nice to be called by name when we went out and even nicer to share a laugh with them. The entertainment was pretty good, and I loved the beach party, great food! It was nice to buy crafts from the locals...and I loved bargaining prices with them. Despite the beautiful conditions of the grounds the fact is that much of Jamaica is poor and they appreciate and need the business. With that being said, don't be afraid to cross the gate and buy from the locals. They are very nice, especially Bridget :) and have some beautiful handmade souvenirs. We got this amazing eagle from "Popcorn". My only complaint was the steady harassment to use the spa services. Seriously I went out of my way to avoid anyone who was even remotely dressed like a massage technician. They went so far as coming out onto the beach and asking you to be serviced. With massage prices at the $100, I think I will settle for one for free from my boo!
reviews.title: "Even Better The Second Time"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ocho Rios-- We made a point to go off the resort and mingle among the locals. Being a Cultural Anthropologist I couldn't resist a genuine opportunity to experience a different culture. It was quite an experience, we never felt unsafe or slightly threatened, and we were able to find someone we trusted to show us around to all the best places in Jamaica that are not quite as publicized!! We got a local Taxi--Cheap Charlie's Taxi's and Tours; Requesting he bring "21" (our tour guide :) with him. If your interested, take the shopping excursion and ask around town for him. He's very popular! There is an amazing place in Ocho where fire can be lit upon water; its beautiful and the guide informed us that the water had healing capabilities! Must see. We went to the Ocean Sky line saw the cruise boats coming in, saw the "local's dunn rivers" where the excess falls came in, ran into local fishermen who caught a HUGE mariner, all in all we got some great pictures and paid less than half of what the average excursion costs through the resort. Because its owned by locals, you definitely won't hear about it at the Tour Desk!!! We did end up booking the Bob Marley tour and it was sooo amazing. I would suggest it for the younger crowd. And if you have anything against marijuana I definitely wouldn't recommend it as you will be offered it many times during your tour. If you're one afraid to venture off into town fear not! You can stay on the resort the whole time and still not be bored. We were there 6 days and on the verge of crying upon departure. The Jewel is a great vacation spot, we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and plan on returning next year! Hopefully we can get a free upgrade then lol! My shower cut off on me twice in the Sapphire! Sincerely Room 2611
reviews.title: The Jewel was good to us! Ocho Rios attractions are the best!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent a week at the Jewel Dunn's River in February 2013. We had a great experience overall, it was the perfect relaxing vacation that we were looking for. We would definitely go back.
reviews.title: Would do it again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pro's:
reviews.title: Dunn's River Resort was a disappointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: - Friendly staff, great service
reviews.title: Fun Time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Very good food (not as good as on a cruise but better than other all inclusive resorts we've been to), though a few things were over salted especially at the Platinum.
reviews.title: Yes...3rd time is a charm!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - A lot of Jamaican food choices (we couldn't get enough of the Jamaican patties at the Coral Café)
reviews.title: Relaxing resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a fantastic time at Jewel. Excellent facility and wonderfull Friendly attentive staff. The resort is small enought that eveyone is on a first name basis after a few days, and you can get to know people, guests and staff. The food was by far the best we have ever had at an All-Inclusive, not your usual buffet fare, and no restrictions at the a-la-carte restaurants too!
reviews.title: Jewel Dunns River is a Diamond

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The on-site SPA was pricey but very good quality, definately treat yourself while there ! We would definately go back to this Jewel.
reviews.title: A Huge Jewel Fan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The little pitch and putt course on the property was fun, tennis courts in good shape, hobi-cats fun and well supervised by Steven ! Thanks for the Sail back when the wind was howling !
reviews.title: Amazing stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very short trip to Dunns River was worth it. The Waterfall Climb is fun, guides are very good and the photographer will make sure theres a nice photo or video of you. The dvd is a better value than the single photos. I was able to grab lots of photos off the video on my computer when I got home. The market was fun and better negotiating than the hotel gift shop for t-shirts or souvenirs. One vendor even came to the hotel later that day to be paid right on time and no hassles - great service Ivan.
reviews.title: Overall a great resort
Great Time!
reviews.text: Our ONLY complaint was the front desk at the hotel would not cash travellers cheques at all. Sorry our tips would have been more generous if they would only have cashed a few travellors cheques for us. Next time we'll take cash.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We absolutely loved staying at the Jewel -- in spite of the fact that it was raining almost the entire time we were in Jamaica! The staff were friendly, helpful, and great fun; in particular, the servers Kevin and Marcia made sure we had a great time at every visit to the restaurants. Of the restaurants, we recommend the Platinum in particular -- we never had a bad dish there. The rest of the food and booze stations were fast, tasty, and convenient, and the staff worked hard to keep us entertained when it was raining. My girlfriend says she got one of the best massages of her life at the spa! I would recommend this resort to anyone, and I've already started telling friends.
reviews.title: fantastic resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Great resort! It is small enough that you can get into any a la carte dinners you would like just by walking in, pools always clean and the bars always stocked. With the small resort it allowed great events like the dinner on the beach the one night for the entire resort and the shows also very good. The beach was nice and no locals walking up asking you to buy things. The food was always hot and tasty! Highly recomended.
reviews.title: Great Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very friendly staff with good food. Our only complaint is that entertainment was geared to people who wanted late night activities. Very little for us old codgers who turn into pumpkins at 10:00. Overall, it was a very pleasurable experience and we look forward to returning in the future.
reviews.title: Friendly, relaxing, enjoyable vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Jewel Dunn Resort was a great vacation. The resort staff were outstanding and provided wonderful service. The pools were clean, lots of activities, and never too crowded. The bars were stocked with premium liquors and located strategically around the resort. The food was good - some selections better than others. The Jade was great and fun. I would highly recommend the Jewel.
reviews.title: Wonderful vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: First off i have to apoligze for writting this review so late I've been ill. My trip was Feb 4,2012 to Feb 11, 2012. This was our 4th trip to Jamacia . Myself my hubby and 4 other couples travel together along with my friends 80 year old mother. We had an amazing time at the Jewel . From before we left New Jersey the jewel was helping us with every detail. They have a facebook page that you can talk to other people that are there and have been there plus their amazing staff will lead you in the right direction answering your questions . The hotel manager Scott Robbins is a rare Gem. He is a hands on type of guy that you wouldnt expect to find at such a amazing place. On super bowl Sunday we had a tailgate party that was so much fun we literally had trucks on the beach with the mounds of food served off the tailgates. Scott was there helping his staff every step of the way. So... my review the hotel was very clean never had problem with the cleanliness of the room. Plenty of pillows towels ect. Room fridge was always stocked we preferred diet soda left them a note and we had extra diet soda. Food in all the resteraunts were above average. and their brick oven pizza was the best . and available till the late hours. also had a grill that was opened 24/7. Staff was top notch. entire staff not a bad one in the bunch. they also come around the pool and beach with drinks and fresh fruit. Our trip was the best we have had anywhere we have went and we have been to Punta Canta DR and cancun as well. Hoping to go back next year.
reviews.title: what an amazing place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You'll find yourself saying, "Wow, that's beautiful!" all the time. From the lobby to the pools, beach, rooms, view, restaurants, etc. Everyone was so friendly. They treated us like real friends even though we had just met. This is a resort for couples, so if you are single you'll probably want to stay someplace else in order to feel comfortable. All ages are welcome here. You could be sitting in the hot tub with a 23 year old couple on your left and an 83 year old couple on your right. Have no fear - everyone is here to have good time.
reviews.title: Really beautiful, but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The pools were gorgeous and spotless, though not heated, so it took a while to get in. Lots of floats to lay on. The hot tubs were really large and very popular. Waiter service at the hot tubs was always good and fast.The swim-up bar was the largest I've ever seen - lots of good times to be had here. No towel rules, thank goodness, you get your towels from the towel guy near the pool and bring them back when you are done - easy. Also, no annoying salespeople walking the beach. They have a few tables set up on the beach where you can walk up to if you are interested in buying anything.
reviews.title: A Rejuvenating Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved the beach. Just a few feet from the pools. White sand and light blue water with thatched huts and lots of free lounge chairs. No rocks and calm. Very attentive waiter service. You'll love it.
reviews.title: HIGHLY HIGHLY recommended !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food was good for the most part. Pizza was great. The Grill food was good depending on who was cooking. On Thursday they switch out people and the quality went way down. Same with pizza. We are Palace Resort members so are completely spoiled in the food and drink departments for all inclusive resorts, thus the 4 star not 5. The personally made omletts were very good at the breakfast buffet. Suggest trying Platinum for breakfast - the Eggs Benedict with jerk chicken was interesting (although they only give you 1/2 a muffin, not the usual two - weird). The Lazagna and stuffed pork with Fontina and prosciutto were the best meals at the Italian restaurant. I heard the red snapper was terrific at Platinum. I thought the steak there was excellent.
reviews.title: Fabulous Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The drinks were the biggest disappointment for me personally. I'm not a scotch drinker like my husband, who had no complaints. I'm into the "drinks of the day" and literally tried about five or six different types per day and was usually not happy with them. However, the two good consistent drinks were the pina colada with extra rum on top and the bloody mary's. The MaiTai's were also good and pretty strong (beware). The champagne was not up to par for me. Johnnie Walker Black could only be had at the Tree bar, otherwise, I think it was "Red" only.
reviews.title: Fantastic Time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took a chance and booked our honeymoon online and we were truly amazed once we arrived to the resort. This resort is a must and well worth the money. The two hour bus ride to the resort was also great. We had never traveled to Jamaica before and the bus ride provided an excellent tour of the island. Once we arrived at the resort we were treated like a king and a queen from beginning to end. The room and ocean view was way beyond my expectations and the food was divine with a variety of options (restaurants, grill, buffet, and pizzeria). We loved to bar in the pool. The staff at Jewel was exceptional and the entertainment and nightlife was great. The tour to Dunn's River Falls was only $36 per person and was an exhilarating experience. The only complaint I have is the cats. I would recommend getting rid of the cats but maybe they are there for a reason.
reviews.title: Fascinating Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011
reviews.text: This place is just O.K for the value & we will probably never return.
reviews.title: Meh.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: PROS
reviews.title: not bad, needs work

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Jason, Starr, Durran, Mario entertainment staff guys were great, girls were lazy and never did much
reviews.title: Very relaxing and nice hotel with everything you need on your vacation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very clean hotel ground and rooms
reviews.title: High quality at a great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just got back from 5 nights, 4 full days at Jewel Dunn. We had a great time. I wished I could have stayed a couple more days. The resort is kept very clean, the staff is friendly and works very hard to make sure the guests are happy. Basil (served drinks on the beach) was very helpful and always had a smile and a drink when needed! The young entertainment staff was so talented and energetic (the Mayor, Happy Feet, Sassy, Awesome, Baby Face,...). We loved the house band! We ate in all of the restaurants and liked them all. I did not have the foods that Keith7 had, but we did not have his experience at all. We did not have a bad experience at all. I had the salmon at the italian restaurant and thought it was perfect. My husband had a chicken florintine dish that was also very tasty. We had a diamond concierge room, which was well worth it for me. I like to have a room as close to the ocean as possible and requested this as well as the 5th floor, which they gave us. We opened the doors or had a drink on the balcony and felt like we were on the beach even when in the room. You could see and hear the ocean all the time. There was noise from the pool area, but that didn't bother us. Also, the bed was extremely comfortable! Loved it. I liked the garden setting surrounding the open air exercise room. I enjoyed using the weights and the hot tub. We did snorkeling through the dive shop on the resort for a fee. We loved it. We also loved the complimentary small catamaran/ sail boat rides. They also have kayaks, but we didn't get to that. The only thing that I would have liked was a longer beach. I did walk and run back and forth over and over which felt a little silly, but it was a way to fill the need. I have not been to other all incusive resorts, so I can't compare, but we had a fantastic vacation and I would recommend this resort!
reviews.title: Great Vacation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just got back from the jewel dunns river resort actually two days earlier since this place was so bad. Honestly the food was barely edible with cold fried calamari only minutes after the restaurant opens. The only meats the had was salami and chicken ham and these were present on the italian antipasto buffet and also on the sandwich the offered at there other buffet. Low and behold at there so called "fancy white glove service restaurant" there offering of assorted smoked meats and cheese was yup you guessed it chicken ham and salami which was still frozen in the middle and run of the mill cheese. THIS ADULTS ONLY RESORT was run by 20 year old kids that yelled and screamed all day long on the beach and at the pool calling themselves the entertainment crew. Mostly they played music annoyed guest as they tried to relax and played volleyball with the visitors. I complained about the loud noise that was called karoke which started at 1130pm and ended at 1:30am and then we had to here all the guest outside our hotel room yelling and screaming as they stumbled to bed. I asked the front desk for a refund for the two days we refused to stay as I could not stomach the food or the noise any longer and they said there was nothing they could do. I would have to contact my travel agent. It cost me $350 extra to change my flight and even that was better than dealing with this place for two more nights. Absolute joke this place is. The website design guy deserves an award for making this place look like a nice sophisticated relaxing adult environment. This place is anything but. DONT MAKE THE SAME MISTAKE I DID RUN FROM THE DUNN!!!!!! AND DONT LOOK BACK
reviews.title: RUN FROM THE DUNN!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Jewel Dunns River Jan 26th to Feb 2nd 2013 and had a great time! The staff at this resort were phenomenal! They went above and beyond! They were always friendly and courteous. We got to know a few bartenders very well and were treated better than any other resort we've been to.
reviews.title: Excellent staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The rooms were a good size and the king size bed was amazing. The only downfall was the size of the bathroom. The shower and tub seemed to be shoved together into a small closet. There was also only a single sink which made getting ready a bit of a hassle.
reviews.title: Hits the spot !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other than the size of the bathroom, the resort was great. Food was good, drinks were great and the weather was nice. There was one day of rain and it seemed as though everyone at the resort wandered around like they were lost. As soon as the rain cleared up, everything was great again.
reviews.title: Nice trip.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed a numerous all inclusives on many islands. The Jewel is top of the list. We were upgraded from a sappire room to a ground floor Emerald. Perfect room, perfect location on the property.
reviews.title: Highly recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: It is very obvious the staff love their job. They were fun, professional and truely made the Jewel vacation one to remember.
reviews.title: Our convention was a blast !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were awed by the time, effort and attention to detail to put on the group parties/dinners. The dinner on the pier was outstanding. The beach party fun. And the anniversary honeymoon party made us feel very special.
reviews.title: A honeymoon to remember!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property is small in comparision to others we have stayed at, to us this was a plus. You got to meet other travelers and see them throughout the property every day. You also got to know the staff this way.
reviews.title: Not a 5 star Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't do much in the way of sight seeing of the property. As there was so much to do, no need to leave. nd this particular trip was about much needed R&R.
reviews.title: You know you're in for a good time when...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I rate this resort a solid 4.5
reviews.title: Travel Agent Just Returned

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For anyone wanting to travel to this property, I highly reccomend.
reviews.title: our long overdue honeymoon / anniversary trip of a lifetime

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Staff at this property is wonderful. They look out for your every need.
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I liked the grounds, the restaurants, rooms.
reviews.title: THIS REALLY WAS A JEWEL.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I want some more Jerk Pork now
reviews.title: We found Paradise

aka: The Jewel Dunn`s River Beach Hotel Ocho Rios
description: Introducing The Jewel Dunn’s River, a new Jamaican beach resort located mere moments from one of Jamaica’s top attractions – spectacular Dunn’s River Falls. The Caribbean’s most romantic, adults-only Jamaican resort is the perfect spot for couples, honeymooners and idyllic weddings. Plus, our all-inclusive resort features the unique ‘Jewel Only’ exclusives you can only discover here. Imagine watching a movie from the comfort of a pool raft and dining by candlelight on a pristine beach – that’s just the beginning. Now visualize your first breath in the morning being filled with fresh ocean air from your room’s private balcony. Picture yourself sipping handmade rum punch served by a pool concierge. Anything is possible at The Jewel.
